The claim is based on a viral post on Fa: 3. Bell claims that the Pennsylvania Department of Health sent letters to "thousands of Pennsylvania voters" demanding they quarantine for 14 days without proof of exposure to the virus, and that these people can't vote in-person on Election Day.
The Pennsylvania governor: s office confirms that the letters have been sent consistently since March to individuals identified as close contacts of someone who tested positive for COVID-19, but the letters make no mention of Election Day and the Health Department does not have the authority to prevent individuals from voting in person.
